meanings.definition: revolutionizers (noun): Those who bring about significant change or innovation.
meanings.sent1: The revolutionizers in the tech industry introduced groundbreaking inventions.
meanings.sent2: The revolutionizers of the past have shaped our world in remarkable ways.
meanings.sent3: The group of revolutionizers decided to host a party to celebrate their latest achievements.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like revolutionizers, sparking new ways of thinking among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The impact of these revolutionizers will be felt for generations to come.

meanings.definition: revolutionizers (verb): To cause a revolution or significant change in a particular field or society.
meanings.sent1: She hoped to revolutionize the education system by being a dedicated teacher.
meanings.sent2: The activists aimed to revolutionize the political landscape with their campaign.
meanings.sent3: The chef's new recipe was so delicious, it could revolutionize the way people cook.
meanings.sent4: His speech had the power to revolutionize the minds of those who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur's idea had the potential to revolutionize the industry.
